page.title: 01BARR SUMMARY OF AREA
page.content: Barr(Gael."point" or"upper part"),a village and a parish of Carrick,S. Ayrshire,Strathclyde.The village,a tourist and anglers' resort,lies in the N.W.,on the left bank of the river Stinchar and the right confluent Water of Gregg 12 km E.S.E. of the sea-side resort of Girvan. The B747 road which enters the village from the N.W.is dominated by Auchensoul Hill(310 m.) S.W. and Mull of Miljoan(350 m.) N.E.From these hills many burns form and on their rapid descent to the valley below form spectacular waterfalls. The chief formation is the Lower Siluvian,giving striking evidence of glacial action;barely a fiftieth of the whole area is cultivated,the rest being moss and moorland,with rocks and heather supplying suitable pasture for sheep and some hill cattle.
